Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b11pre) Gecko/20110129 Firefox/4.0b11pre

Observe! This is my first bug reported at Bugzilla@Mozilla.

Since Nightly on 29 January 2011 there's a small overlay on top of content at bottom of screen, to show this information is very good but I would be better to show this information closer to the location bar, for example at top of screen on top of content. If you see status activity info closer to the location bar it's more consistent UI and easier to see because you are already looking up after seeing link preview in the location bar.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Click on an any link
2. See 
3.
Actual Results:  
Small overlay on top of content at bottom of screen is shown with connecting, waiting, loading status messages.

Expected Results:  
Small overlay on top of content at the top of screen is shown with connecting, waiting, loading status messages. Just below the location bar, to the top-left of content.

This is my first bug reported at Bugzilla@Mozilla. Please be kind to me regarding methodology of reporting bugs.

This makes perfectly good sense as a more logical place to display this status.

However, the reason for displaying it at the bottom is to not obscure important content.  After all if your window were a few pixels shorter, the portion of the content hidden by this status would not be visible anyway.

comments.raw_text:
Bill, I can agree that more important content is located on the top. These status messages are only visible for 1-2 seconds in most cases. I think that the status messages are important to the user and it would be OK to have these on top of content even if it hide other important content. For me it's easier to understand current page URL in location bar and preview link in location bar, then have status messages shown below the location bar rather than on bottom of screen.

(FYI. I don't miss the status bar and I like having preview link in location bar on the right with reload button inside there too.)

comments.raw_text:
Just for the record, the original plan was to show the status information inside the location bar, and tone it down when it isn't relevant, e.g:

* Show the full extent of what's going on with servers etc before we have drawn anything on the page

* Once the page starts rendering, only show the network traffic details if it's experiencing delays (e.g. if you've waited 3-5 seconds for a server to respond, we should show more details, so you know that you're waiting for it)

This isn't what ended up happening, but I agree that having the information located near the other progress and URL details makes a lot more sense. Not the UX team's decision at this point, alas.
